fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1368].
  {panel}

The following changes can be made to make Portfolio more accessible to people with disabilities:

- Make everything accessible via the keyboard. Includes
-- Table column headers
-- Expanding/collapsing table rows
-- Re-ranking table rows
-- Information displayed on mouse hover
-- Reports
- Keyboard navigation should not become trapped in an input field
- Input fields should have names to inform blind users what field they are on
- Text-less buttons should have a name

Generally speaking, the goal is to reach [Section 508 compliance|http://www.508checker.com/what-is-508-compliance].
fields.summary: Improve accessibility
Sorting for different columns
Separate release streams - Live plans
Show original estimates in Live plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1364].
  {panel}

To be able to pick which specific fields should be updated to the respective JIRA issue when commited. Similar to the "Apply updates to project/s" options in standard plans.

h2. *Workaround*
*Don't commit releases as a whole*
This isn't the optimal solution but the best one we have for now.

* Create the planning release only in Portfolio
* When committing don't commit this entire category of changes (Filter the category using the dropdown in the commit dialog). 

Release assignment will remain pending as it does not exist in JIRA while other changes on that issue will apply.
fields.summary: Select specific fields to be updated in JIRA on commit - Live plans

fields.description:
Instructions for completing a form, such as creating an epic, must be available somewhere on the page or via keyboard. The following items revealed information with the mouse that was not available elsewhere or with the keyboard.

1. In the Plan->Backlog, when you create a new epic and hover over the title you receive instructions about needing to fill out the estimate in order to schedule the epic. Not available elsewhere on the screen or with keyboard.

2. In the plan->Backlog, the Export button in the top menu reveals "export to csv" which is not available on screen or with the keyboard.
fields.summary: Information only available via mouse-over

fields.description:
The following buttons do not have sufficient name or title information available to blind users.

1. In Plan->Backlog, Release, Team, the Export button in the top menu does not have a name.

2.  In Plan->Backlog, Release, Team, the Search button in the top menu does not have a name.

3. In  Plan->Reports->Themes, the pie chart image does not have any alternative text.
fields.summary: No valid name or title information for buttons / images

fields.description:
In the tables for a Plans Backlog, Release, and Teams, the table headers are not programmatically identified.

When creating a new epic or story, team, or release in Portfolio, the form field does not tell a blind user what field they are on for title, stages and skills, or any column in any of these tables.

It also does not tell you which column you are on in an existing epic, team or release.

Screen shots attached.
fields.summary: Jira Portfolio Table Accessibility

fields.description:
I have found the following keyboard traps in Jira Portfolio which make it in accessible to keyboard only users. The focus becomes trapped in a menu and you cannot escape it without using a mouse. The normal Jira keyboard shortcuts did not appear to be effective.

1. In a Plan, in either the Backlog, Team, Release, or Reports view, when you use they keyboard to enter a column filter, you can modify all of the filter selections, but you cannot exit the menu for filter selections using the keyboard only.

2. In a Plan->Backlog, at the bottom of the page, when the schedule is visible, if you enter the schedule settings you cannot escape the setting menu without using the mouse.
fields.summary: Keyboard Traps - Accessibility Jira Portfolio

fields.description:
We have found the following interactions are not accessible via the keyboard. It may be that these are accessible via keyboard shortcuts, but the existing Jira keyboard shortcuts did not work as expected.

In the Jira Portfolio->Plan->Backlog
- unable to access the details link in the epic/story title
- unable to expand epics to see the stories below
- unable to access the schedule below the backlog list
- unable to change the priority of epics / stories (i.e. drag them up and down in the list)

In the Jira Portfolio ->Plan->Schedule->Capacity view
- unable to access the columns in the capacity view or the links for the sprint which tell you the details of the capacity for each sprint

Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Inaccessible to keyboard-only users - accessibility

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1358].
  {panel}

In a certain user case, we use the story points field on the epic to provide us with a rough estimate of the work that the epic is going to take. Let's call this 100 pts.
We then would break down the epic into the user stories to fulfil the epic, we'll call this 75pts as the sum of the stories under the epic.

Portfolio would show us a total of 175 pts for the epic, the sum of the epic including the sum of the children. The scenario we were expecting was to see the sum of just the children at 75, and we'd be able to use JQL to calculate based off the estimate of 100 we only planned 75, so we overestimated by 25pts.

What we would like is at each level, to have an estimate field in portfolio that will be stored on the individual tickets as well as the actuals.
We're looking to be able to baseline Initiatives, Epics, and Stories with their original estimates as well as the actuals.
fields.summary: Ability to have an estimate field that can be stored on the individual tickets as well as the actuals
Make Portfolio Live Plans issue hierarchy information visible in JIRA

  {panel}

Feedback from one of our users:

I've been looking at the time estimates and it seems that the "Time Estimates" column in Portfolio maps to the remaining estimates at the story level. It's great how Portfolio:
a. Calculates the remaining estimates and adds them to view at the Epic level and it 
b. Allows you to add additional estimates at the Epic level too
However, it would be brilliant if it could:
1. Show the Original Estimate and allow it to be added / removed on the column view
2. Show the Work Logged and allow this field to be added / removed onthe column view
3. Rename the existing Time Estimates column header to Remaining so it more clearly maps to the JIRA ticket information itself (took me a while to figure out what it was doing...)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an Agile board with containing an epic and a child story
2. Add the epic and story to a sprint
3. Create a Portfolio Live Plan based on this board
4. Close both the epic and the story

Expected:
- Both show up as completed in the backlog

Actual:
- Only the story show up in the backlog.

Workaround:
Change the Completion date filter to something other than "Current sprint", the epic should show up again.
fields.summary: Completed epics do not show up when the Completion date filter is set to "Current sprint"
Ability to turn off sorting by columns and revert to rank

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1351].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we are have dependencies when the completion of Epic/Story it would start the other Epic/Story however we do not have a delay configuration for it, example:
{quote}
We are planning a project, where we order from a 3rd party supplier (for example) an internet connection. We know from this point where we order the internet-connection till that one getting delivered it will take around 1 week. In this time-frame we don't need to reserve any resources or something, because we just need simply to wait. 

For this I would like to say, that between these 2 stories in portfolio:  
- "Order an Internet-connection" and 
- "Delivery and testing of an Internet-Connection"
I want to put dependencies where I say that "Delivery and testing of an Internet-Connection" can only start when "Order an Internet-connection" has been finished 7 days ago. 

This not only work for "Internet connection", could also be that we need to order any other 3rd party support. 
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Maybe we can have a configuration to set the delay such as number of days before the start of another Epic/Story.
fields.summary: Dependencies between story/epics with delay

fields.description:
We have a scenario when our product owner defines high level roadmap in JIRA Portfolio.
Having backlog defined, he links already existing (estimated) JIRA issues to backlog items. 
_Saying "links" I mean selecting concrete JP Backlog item, then selecting "Issue link" column within it and  picking "Link existing issue" option (see screenshot attached)_

Story points-based estimate from JIRA issue does't get automatically uploaded to JP.
Moreover, if we sync JP and Jira Project, still empty estimate within JP (because its "arrival" from JIRA project has been waited) resets estimates in Jira Issue.

So, my question is: what should be done in order to get estimates from JIRA issue automatically uploaded to JP *when exactly linking backlog item to issue*, *not when importing filter results to JP*?
fields.summary: Linking JP Backlog item to estimated JIRA story doesn't take estimate in JP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1349].
  {panel}

As a user I would like to have possibility to make simulation of future sprints in two modes:
a) Planning based on capacity (current approach)
b) Planning based on story order

Here’s the example:

Let’s say that we have following backlog for some team:
- Story1 (10 points)
- Story2 (5 points)
- Story3 (8 points)
- Story4 (2 points)

Velocity of the team is 20 points.

In mode a) planning fills the sprints with stories until reaching team velocity. So it looks like that:

Planning of sprint 1:
- Story1 goes into sprint (10 / 20 points used)
- Story2 goes into sprint (15 / 20 points used)
- Story3 is too big
- Story4 goes into sprints (17 / 20 points used)

Planning of sprint 2:
- Story3 goes into sprint (8 / 20 points used)

What happened? Order of stories in sprints is different than order in the backlog. In real world sometimes it’s possible, but sometimes it has no sense. There could be situation where we have some dependencies – Story4 cannot be implemented before Story3.

In mode b) planning fills the sprints without changing their order. So it goes like that:

Planning of sprint 1:
- Story1 goes into sprint (10 / 20 points used)
- Story2 goes into sprint (15 / 20 points used)
- Story3 is too big – algorithm finishes planning here

Planning of sprint 2:
- Story3 goes into sprint (8 / 20 points used)
- Story4 goes into sprints (10 / 20 points used)
fields.summary: Live Plan - planning stories according to their order
Ability to display and search/filter on assigned teams in JIRA
Indicate Overcapacity for fixed timebox
When moving an Epic to a different Initiative, maintain the link in JIRA

fields.description:
I created a plan with the following config:

- 1 filter data source for initiatives
- 1 board source for epics and stories

I removed the default team created by the initiative filter but left the one for the board.

I then created a sprint in the board and added a bunch of stories

I returned to Portfolio and created 2 additional teams, each with a velocity of 20, and assigned one of the existing issues in the sprint to one of these teams. On recalculate nothing happened. I removed the issue from the sprint and tried again and it was correctly assigned to the manually created team.

I then set the source for the two manual teams to the same board, changed the team on one of the issues in the sprint and recalculated, nothing happened. I committed all the changes to JIRA and recalculated again, still nothing.

I tried deleting the default team and all issues in the sprint moved to the first of the manually created teams, which then exhibited the same behaviour.

Not sure if this is expected behaviour or not, however we do have a lot of teams that share boards so they can work in the same sprints, so this could cause some issues for us.
fields.summary: Cannot change team if source is a board and sprint exists

fields.description:
Hello - I am having an issue with the sprints in my LivePlan being out of order from the Jira sprints. It is not clear how to determine what is causing this. I have entered this as a bug as I do not get an option to create a new support request though I am logged in and can only see historical support requests. 

We are trying to determine why our releases appear overbooked and this may be part of the cause.The sprints are showing up as follows: S119, S121, S122, S120. They should be in numeric order. S119 is currently started, the rest are not. I have checked that the sprint reference is in sequential order as shown below.

S119 = 9041
S120 = 9042
S121 = 10539
S122 = 10540

I have attached a shot of the agile board and the LivePlan showing the sprints. Is this a bug or what should I be doing to determine the cause?

Thank you for your insight on this challenge.
fields.summary: LivePlan Sprints Out of Order

* Open the issue source configuration of your plan
* Try to add all children of an issue (for which only some children are part of the plan) by clicking the checkbox on the parent issue
* All children appear selected
* Click _Done_

Expected result:
All child issues are now part of the plan

Actual result:
None of the previously excluded issues were added to the plan

Work-around:
Select all child issues individually

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1331].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Due to the current scheduling algorithm used in JIRA Portfolio, there would be cases where there will be interruptions in stories.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option to disallow interruptions of stories
fields.summary: As a user, I want the option to disallow interruptions of stories
Ability to Export individual projects to .csv
Provide a more helpful message when the horizon is hit because of the "Minimum Load" constraint

* this team has no actual working resource

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1327].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no unique permission in Portfolio Global Permissiosn to allow an user to view all the plans.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a permission in Portfolio Global Permission to be granted for users to be able to view all the plans in the system.
 
h3. Workaround 
Add either the administrator or a group of which the administrator is member of with at least view permissions on every plan (or make the plans completely public, i.e., have no plan-level restrictions).
fields.summary: Have a permission in Portfolio to be able to view all the plans

fields.description:
Whenever changes to the included issues of a Live Plan are made via the setup page, an exception might occur if the _Issues without parent Epic_ is not selected.

*Workaround:*
To prevent the exception from happening, make sure to select the _Issues without parent Epic_ entry and then de-select the items beneath it you want to exclude from the plan.

fields.summary: Potential exception when confirming changes to Live Plans setup
Show Portfolio Plan creators
Allow releases to be grouped into cross-project releases
Subtasks influence the scheduling priority of their parent issue in Live Plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1322].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Currently, Epics/Initiatives will be automatically complete once its children are completed. In some cases, users still would like to add more stories for that Epic.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great if there was an option to disable and enable it.
fields.summary: An option to prevent automatically complete Epic/Initiative once its children are complete
Cyclic dependencies based on release and issue requirements not detected correctly
Update Documentation For Story points
Sprint numbering doesn't consider completed sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1317].
  {panel}

This is very confusing to me and I'm really hoping this is poor understanding on my part.

I want to be able to allow a client access to a specific plan. I want them to be able to make changes to the plan but not to apply any updates back to Jira Agile. 

I've set up a user group for a restricted user and added them to it, but how do I actually get this to work? I don't want them to see all plans so I need to add their name to a plan but if I do they either get full editor permissions, or viewer only permissions, neither of which are suitable.

As I understand it right now, the permissions set up would mean I can't allow them 'Rectricted User' access and keep plans between clients confidential, which is a major concern and can not happen under any circumstances.
fields.summary: Permissions at plan level conflict with global permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1316].
  {panel}

The Business Value of an Initiative or Epic is the most important parameter for prioritization.
However JIRA Portfolio does not have a field or column to indicate the Business Value.

Oddly enough the CSV export includes a field or column "BusinessValue", just next to "Estimate_Total" and "Estimate_Original" ...

Please make the Business Value field or column visible and editable in JIRA Portfolio.
fields.summary: Business Value field editable
Different blocks in timeline for different releases of the same initiative

Add links to epics, projects or tasks in releases report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1312].
  {panel}

At the moment, whenever all children of a backlog element are closed, the parent gets closed automatically as well. In some situations it would be desirable to keep the parent open in such a situation because the epic is not yet fully completed (there might be more stories to be added in the future or there is an estimate on the epic itself in JIRA that has not yet been broken down further). This epic serves as a reminder that there is still work to be done.

*Workaround*
Create a placeholder child entry that remains open to keep the parent entry from getting closed.


*Original ticket report*
***Support request***

I have instances where initiatives or epics aren't necessarily completed when their children are completed. It may be there are further epics or tasks to add.

How do I get the system to stop automatically marking an initiative or epic as complete when it's child epics or tasks are completed?
fields.summary: Stop automatically marking initiatives or epics as completed when their children are done

fields.description:
Scenario: We have created a portfolio plan which is set to use hours as the estimate method. After we complete planning for an initiative, we create the Epics and stories in Jira and then use the option "Marking child items as complete" to close the planning of the the initiative in portfolio and track the progress via Jira sprints and boards. We believe this option would just hide the items in the portfolio. We like this idea of this option because we want a way to indicate planning is done but we can still see what we had planned by selecting to show these items using the status filter. 

When I select the option "Mark child items as complete" portfolio I found it is resetting the estimate of the stories in Jira. Using this option resets any hours of work the team has logged for the stories setting it back to the original estimate. This causes a blip in the burndown and very sad engineers. 

My expectation is that marking child items as complete in portfolio would not update anything in Jira.  

To repro:
Create a plan with the estimates set as hours. 
Create one initiative, one epic and a few stories. Set estimates on the stories in portfolio
Use the open to create and link new issues in jira
Open the new stories and log work for each one. 
Return back to portfolio and select the option "mark child items as complete" at the Epic level 
Return back to the stories and see the remaining estimate is set to the original estimate.

Is this expected? Are there other things that the mark child items as complete does that I should be mindful of? Is using this option in the scenario I have articulated valid?
fields.summary: Mark child items as complete updates the estimates
Unable to edit team velocity in LivePlan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1308].
  {panel}

An Epic/Story can currently hold two constraints ("Requires" and "Required By"). I would like to add another constraint to tell portfolio to schedule epics/stories to start at the same time.

For example:
- I want Team 1 to work on a design 1 for product 1
- I want Team 2 to work on a design 2 for product 1
- Both issues should start at the same time and (if both have the same estimate) end at the same time in order to evaluate design 1 and design 2 and pick a winner
fields.summary: As a user I want to explicitly schedule 2 epics/stories to start at the same time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1301].
  {panel}

It will be good if these two menu items under Plan in Portfolio are hidden under the Configure Menu.
- Apply Updates to Projects
- Update from date

And the Configure menu is available to admins only. There is no safety mechanism here or a way to undo changes if someone erroneously run an update and the settings are not what we want it to be.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1297].
  {panel}

Changes are made to all projects even if you select a single filter.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Import an epic into portfolio, and assigned it to the “Team X".
# Modify the estimate to 1 hour or something, then I changed it back to 0
# Select an existing filter, different or which not includes any issue from the Project where Team X is associated.
# Apply updates to projects.

h3. Expected results:

Only the issues from the selected filter are notified/updated.

h3. Current results

All issues imported to your plan are modified.

h3. Workaround

There's no current workaround for that.

Affected version: v1.12.1-OD-001-D20160203T091350
fields.summary: Portfolio apply changes to all projects

fields.description:
Description
I previously added several shared teams (/jira/secure/TeamManagement.jspa) and try to map one of those to my plan (/jira/secure/PortfolioPlanView.jspa?id=4#people) by clicking the "+ Add team" link.
Unfortunately i cant select one of the teams. After selection the option "Use existing shared team" the dropdown only shows "No matches".
fields.summary: Shared teams unavailable for Live plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1293].
  {panel}

Description:
I have multiple sources, each of which is a board.

To reproduce the issue:
1. Go to Schedule Settings, select Line: Global, Grouping: None

Result:
"This view is only available if all teams are on the same schedule."

My teams are on the same schedule, they all started on 9 Feb, and all last 2 weeks.

I noticed that on the graphical schedule, the left boundary of the Epics (or Stories, it doesn't matter) of one of the teams, appears on 8 Feb, i.e. the day BEFORE they actually started the sprint. All the others are in line, slightly to the right, on 9 Feb, as I would expect.

Here are the start/end dates from the Sprint Report for the current sprint on all the projects.

    Team 1: 09/Feb/16 10:31 AM - 23/Feb/16 10:31 AM
    Team 2: 09/Feb/16 3:08 PM - 23/Feb/16 3:08 PM
    Team 3: 09/Feb/16 2:48 PM - 23/Feb/16 2:48 PM
    Team 4: 09/Feb/16 3:32 PM - 23/Feb/16 3:32 PM

Team 1 is the one that JPO is showing started on 8 Feb, and therefore probably why it thinks the teams are not on the same schedule.

Is there a date boundary issue? Note that I am in New Zealand. The above times are correct local times; JPO may be doing something funky when it tries to work out dates.
fields.summary: Teams not deemed to be on same schedule in Live plans, but they are
Option needed to to show unsized stories on the schedule view

  {panel}

When defining data sources that include some subtasks but not their parents may result in a scheduling error, if the subtask has an issue link defined that is configured to be a Portfolio dependency.

Workaround: adapt the data source to also include the parent of all subtasks or remove the issue link type from the Portfolio Dependency configuration.

After using the board as a source for a Live Plans project, only some of the stories show up in the right sprints. Others are pushed into the future. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1276].
  {panel}

I am using Portfolio to plan multiple projects that are being worked on in Jira Agile.

I use Initiatives for Projects and import Epics and child issues as they are set up in the Jira Agile project.

The act of importing epics and issues into Portfolio is rather cumbersome without being able to bulk assign, so I don't want to be doing this regularly.

However, from time to time, child issues get moved from one epic to another in Jira Agile. 

I've to find a report in Jira Agile that identifies when issues move to another epic but this doesn't seem possible.  

Is there a way that Portfolio can pick this up?
fields.summary: Is there a way to track linked tasks that have moved epics in Jira Agile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1275].
  {panel}

In the Epic or Initiative view, I'd like to be able to filter by Initiative so that I can only see information relating to a specific Initiative on the screen.

h1. Story

As a Product Manager, I want to be able to filter by Initiative or Epic, in order to help frame discussion and presentation when diving into Epic and Story view.
h1. Expansion

As my team get's deeper into Portfolio, we have multiple Product Mangers interacting with the same Plan. While we can drive high-level engagement using the Portfolio plan, it becomes a less useful when I want to focus on a specific Initiative, it's components or deliverables, as I can't provide a specific view.

This is especially obvious when I have more than one project which contributes to the same Initiative, and I'm engaging in focused project reviews with stakeholders.
fields.summary: Ability to filter by Initiative
Make bulk changes within Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1273].
  {panel}

h2. Summary

Currently the scheduling algorithm uses the stack-ranking of epics to determine scheduling constraints. If an individual creates an initiative later that supersedes another intiative then they have to manually pull up all the epics in that initiative above the epics in another initiative to reflect this relative initiative prioritzation. It would be very helpful if in the scheduling configuration section if you could designate priority on an initiative basis as opposed to an epic basis.

h2. Background
Our organization is very initiative focused and we determine organizational priorities based on the initiatives. We recently had a late initiative come into place that superseded all other initiatives. As we began to build the plan, bucket work into epics and then stories, some of these high priority epics were seemingly started later than expected causing an unrealistic timeline. This caused a lot of manual work to change the epic prioritization to match the initiative priortization.
fields.summary: Allow scheduling algorithm to use initiative backlog for prioritization as opposed to epic backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1270].
  {panel}

When a user creates an epic in an _Agile_ project via the _Create Epic_ dialog from Portfolio, the configuration for which fields should be visible gets lost when
* switching from _Custom_ to _All_ and back
* the dialog is opened the next time

Expected behaviour:
The field configuration set in the _Create Epic_ dialog is remembered and applied the next time the dialog opens
fields.summary: When creating an epic in JIRA via Portfolio, the Create Epic dialog does not remember field configurations made previously
Show the Issue in the Portfolio backlog that you are highlighting in the scheduling view
Provide Auto-sync option for Epic Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1267].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Definition

At the moment, the schedule and reports pages only display open tickets (open in the Portfolio-sense, that is decoupled from the actual JIRA issues status). This is due to the fact that the schedule was designed to show future data and requires the items to be displayed to have a calculated start and end date as well as assigned teams, releases, sprints, etc.

However, having an option to show completed issues / historic data in the schedule and reports page would add a lot of value. This would require storing the last calculated values (including start and end dates) on the issue before closing it in Portfolio. It might also require additional filter capabilities b/c including all past issues, the timeline could get significantly longer and more difficult to read.

h4. Suggested Solution

Add an option to show completed issues/historic data in Schedule and reports.
fields.summary: Allow to show completed issues in schedule and reports pages
Add "Theme" view in addition to Initiatives and Epics view for Backlog and Reporting
Calculate actual values in reports page based on progress for plans in story points
